speaker: Programmer
text: Hello Apiza,

speaker: Programmer
text: are the functions of libssh preceeded by 'ssh'?

speaker: Apiza
text: Hi Programmer_11.

speaker: Apiza
text: Most of the functions of LibSSH are preceded by `ssh`.

speaker: Apiza
text: An example is `ssh_basename`.

speaker: Apiza
text: Some functions are not preceded by `ssh`,

speaker: Apiza
text: for example, `channel_read_buffer`.

speaker: Programmer

speaker: Apiza
text:
```

```

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
This function can set all possible ssh options.

speaker: Apiza
text: I'm not sure what you mean by that.

speaker: Apiza
text: Which constant are you wondering about?

speaker: Programmer
text: I want to know the constant when the server is known

speaker: Apiza
text: Does this information about `ssh_options_set` help?\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Parameters\nvalue: The value to set. This is a generic pointer and the datatype which is used should be set according to the type set.

speaker: Apiza
text: Here is some documentation that might help:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
int ssh_is_server_known	(	ssh_session 	session	)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Check if the server is known.
Checks the user's known host file for a previous connection to the current server.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
session: The SSH session to use.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
SSH_SERVER_KNOWN_OK: The server is known and has not changed.
SSH_SERVER_KNOWN_CHANGED: The server key has changed. Either you are under attack or the administrator changed the key. You HAVE to warn the user about a possible attack.
SSH_SERVER_FOUND_OTHER: The server gave use a key of a type while we had an other type recorded. It is a possible attack.
SSH_SERVER_NOT_KNOWN: The server is unknown. User should confirm the MD5 is correct.
SSH_SERVER_FILE_NOT_FOUND: The known host file does not exist. The host is thus unknown. File will be created if host key is accepted.
SSH_SERVER_ERROR: Some error happened.

speaker: Apiza
text: See also\nssh_get_pubkey_hash()\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Bug:\nThere is no current way to remove or modify an entry into the known host table.\n```

speaker: Programmer
text: Perfect

speaker: Programmer
text: How do I create a new channel?

speaker: Apiza
text: Try this function:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
sftp_session sftp_new_channel	(	ssh_session 	session,
ssh_channel 	channel 
)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Start a new sftp session with an existing channel.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
session: The ssh session to use.
channel: An open session channel with subsystem already allocated

Returns
A new sftp session or NULL on error.

speaker: Apiza
text: See also\nsftp_free()\n```

speaker: Programmer
text: Sorry,

speaker: Programmer
text: how do I create a ssh_channel?

speaker: Apiza
text: Try this function:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
ssh_channel ssh_channel_new	(	ssh_session 	session	)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Allocate a new channel.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
session: The ssh session to use.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
A pointer to a newly allocated channel, NULL on error.

```

speaker: Programmer
text: How do I open a new session in a channel?

speaker: Programmer
text: And how do I execute a command?

speaker: Apiza
text: Try this function to open a new session in a channel:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
int ssh_channel_open_session	(	ssh_channel 	channel	)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Open a session channel (suited for a shell, not TCP forwarding).

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
channel: An allocated channel.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

speaker: Apiza
text:
See also
ssh_channel_open_forward()
ssh_channel_request_env()
ssh_channel_request_shell()
ssh_channel_request_exec()

```

speaker: Apiza
text: Try this function to execute a command:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
int ssh_channel_request_exec	(	ssh_channel 	channel,
const char * 	cmd 
)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Run a shell command without an interactive shell.
This is similar to 'sh -c command'.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
channel: The channel to execute the command.
cmd: The command to execute (e.g. "ls ~/ -al | grep -i reports").

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns\nSSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.\n

speaker: Apiza
Apiza
text:
See also
ssh_channel_request_shell()


```

speaker: Programmer
text: How is the syntax of the read of a channel method?

speaker: Programmer
text: Ok, nothing,

speaker: Programmer
text: I have seen it in the previous one

speaker: Apiza
text: Does this documentation help?\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
int ssh_channel_read	(	ssh_channel 	channel,
void * 	dest,
uint32_t 	count,
int 	is_stderr 
)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Reads data from a channel.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
channel: The channel to read from.
dest: The destination buffer which will get the data.
count: The count of bytes to be read.
is_stderr: A boolean value to mark reading from the stderr flow.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
The number of bytes read, 0 on end of file or SSH_ERROR on error. In nonblocking mode it Can return 0 if no data is available or SSH_AGAIN.

```

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I start a sftp session?

speaker: Programmer
text: sftp connection,

speaker: Programmer
text: sorry

speaker: Apiza
text: Try this function:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
sftp_session sftp_new	(	ssh_session 	session	)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Start a new sftp session.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
session: The ssh session to use.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
A new sftp session or NULL on error.

speaker: Apiza
text:

```

speaker: Programmer
text: And to initialize a sftp connection?

speaker: Apiza
text: Try this function:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
int sftp_init	(	sftp_session 	sftp	)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Initialize the sftp session with the server.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
sftp: The sftp session to initialize.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh error set.

speaker: Apiza
text:
See also
sftp_new()

```

speaker: Programmer
text: Can you give me the complete documentation about the method sftp_mkdir?

speaker: Apiza
text: Here is the complete documentation for `sftp_mkdir`:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
Apiza
text:
Description
Create a directory.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
sftp: The sftp session handle.
directory: The directory to create.
mode: Specifies the permissions to use. It is modified by the process's umask in the usual way: The permissions of the created file are (mode & ~umask)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

speaker: Apiza
text:
See also
sftp_get_error()

```

speaker: Programmer
text: Can you tell me more about the modes of sftp_mkdir method?

speaker: Programmer
text: And about the method sftp_open?

speaker: Apiza
text: Here is the definition of `mode_t`:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```\n typedef int mode_t;\n```

speaker: Apiza
text: Here is some documentation about `sftp_open`:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
Apiza
text:
Description
Open a file on the server.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
session: The sftp session handle.
file: The file to be opened.
accesstype: Is one of O_RDONLY, O_WRONLY or O_RDWR which request opening the file read-only,write-only or read/write. Acesss may also be bitwise-or'd with one or more of the following: O_CREAT - If the file does not exist it will be created. O_EXCL - When used with O_CREAT, if the file already exists it is an error and the open will fail. O_TRUNC - If the file already exists it will be truncated.
mode: Mode specifies the permissions to use if a new file is created. It is modified by the process's umask in the usual way: The permissions of the created file are (mode & ~umask)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
A sftp file handle, NULL on error with ssh and sftp error set.

speaker: Apiza
text:
See also
sftp_get_error()


```

speaker: Programmer
text: What about the third parameter of the sftp_mkdir method?

speaker: Apiza
text:
The third parameter of the `sftp_mkdir` method is:

```
mode_t mode
```

speaker: Apiza
text: The `mode` parameter of `sftp_mkdir` is a Unix permission number for the created file.

speaker: Programmer
text: Which is the error of existing directory?

speaker: Apiza
text: Here is a function that might help with that:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
int sftp_get_error	(	sftp_session 	sftp	)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Get the last sftp error.
Use this function to get the latest error set by a posix like sftp function.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
sftp: The sftp session where the error is saved.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
The saved error (see server responses), < 0 if an error in the function occured.

speaker: Apiza
text:
See also
Server responses

```
